intro: Alcea rosulata, commonly known as the rose of Sharon, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Alcea rosulata is known for its adaptability and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens.
